intro: Cnesmocarpon, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that often appear in clusters, giving it a spectral appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are usually finely divided and aromatic, similar to those of other members of the carrot family. Cnesmocarpon species are relatively rare and are often found in specific regions of Southeast Asia.
